channel.title: Big Data in Biomedicine
channel.description: Recent content on Big Data in Biomedicine

item.description: I am a Master’s student in Bioinformatics at the TUM and LMU in Munich since autumn 2018. Right before, I received a Bachelor’s degree in Bioinformatics from the Goethe University in Frankfurt, where I wrote my thesis in the machine learning area. At the Chair of Experimental Bioinformatics I am working on SPONGE with the goal to detect and visualize ceRNA interactions based on miRNA expression data.

item.title: SPONGEdb: a pan-cancer resource for competing endogenous RNA interactions
